title: FIX THE FUCKING BOT INFESTATION IN "CO-OP VS AI"!
body:
HAVE SOME FUCKING LOVE FOR YOUR GAME AND FIX THIS SHIT ALREADY!

WHY DO I HAVE TO BE PUNISHED FOR DODGING A GAME FILLED WITH 9 BOTS!?

replies.body: I went ahead and looked into this account for ya, but it doesn't actually look like you have any punishments currently or in the recent past. If you're referring to a different account, I'm more than happy to look into what happened for you!

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=VE4ZholY,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-07-22T03:32:41.743+0000)
>
> I went ahead and looked into this account for ya, but it doesn't actually look like you have any punishments currently or in the recent past. If you're referring to a different account, I'm more than happy to look into what happened for you!

Feel free to ignore if this isn't your cup of tea or you feel like this isn't worth responding to.

I've just been following the Red Tracker a little bit tonight and I've come across a few instances where the players claimed to have been punished, while you guys at Riot are unable to see any recent punishments on their account. Could this possibly be a bug where some punishments aren't being properly reported to Riot servers? I feel like this may be worth looking into.
It's more likely that the punishment had already been played through (for LPQ's) or that they were talking about a different account. More often than not it's on a completely different account.

Quick question: Other than reporting in the post game lobby, is there something else I can do to report Botting in Co-op VS AI games. After every game I try to report all the bot accounts, I would just like to know if there is something more I can do to help you guys catch these accounts.
Reporting in post game is the best way to make sure their account is flagged for investigation.

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=VE4ZholY,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-07-22T21:38:32.574+0000)
>
> Reporting in post game is the best way to make sure their account is flagged for investigation.

Is there a certain report type that is better than others?

okay let me try to clarify here as its been on my mind too.

its understood that frequent reporting devalues your reports weight.

that said if i reported every autoit grade suicide bot in intermediate coop v ai i have seen this week, i would have filed over 50 reports for that span. i've even gotten to see some minor evolution like them saying random prefab words or sentances. i esp liked the just respawned lulu saying oom on respawn in fountain.

i don't think you grasp the scale of the problem numbers wise.

i and i figure others too, are just letting it ride instead of reporting purely because of how many there are lest our reports should we need them for people actually doing something really not good go nowhere.

it isn't terribly hard to spot the level 30 no mastery no rune runs to a specific spot behind mid turret and attack moves forwards rinse repeats. it is slightly harder to discriminate between the ones that will actually lane change or with limited chat capability, especially on lower level accounts, but still identifiable with game time.

frankly its a little sad the quality of them if one has any practical familiarity with nn training/ml, but its also clear from their inability to keep their bots connected reliably that whoever is running them en masse is doing so fast and cheap not good.

worse one doesn't want to throw one at a newbie somehow in intermediate for their 5th ever game of league on a given account for behaving similarly and showing poorly without chatting.

i get its a tough problem for you guys for that sort of reason, but frankly it has been a growing problem in now deprecated dominion, then twisted treeline and now sr 5s coopvai right up to intermediate.

to wit, i am likely understating it when i indicate reporting 50 over the last week from coop v ai intermediate matches and i just don't report them all by far because it feels like i can't.

more humans than player sided bots is becoming the rarity not the norm.


lastly just what the heck is the proper report for the bot using accounts?
when i do actually report them i go with intentionally feeding+cheating/third party program and text fill suicide bot.
feels like there should be a specific just for botting, even if it would be an unapproved third party program.
Think he is talking about queue dodge timer...
Queue dodges are a punishment that we'd see in the same section, but alas, nothing there either!
